name: Crystal Palace FC History Quiz | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what year were Crystal Palace formed?
questions.explanation:
1905.

	Although a team by the same name were formed in 1861, this is the official year that Crystal Palace FC were formed.

questions.text: At which ground did the club first play their home games?
questions.explanation:
Crystal Palace.

	The club played at Crystal Palace until 1915, when they moved to Herne Hill for a few seasons, and played at The Nest between 1918-24, before making Selhurst Park their home.

questions.text: Who was Palace's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
John T.  Robson

	Robson was the club's manager between 1905-07, Goodman between 1907-25, followed by Maley (1925-27), and Maven (1927-30).

questions.text: Which of these scored the most goals in a season for the club?
questions.explanation:
Peter Simpson.

	Simpson scored 46 goals in the 1930-31 Division Three (South) season.

questions.text: Which season saw palace first play in the Football League?
questions.explanation:
1920-21.

	Palace played in Division Three in the 1920-21 season, and finshed as champions with 59 points, 5 ahead of second placed Southampton.

questions.text: How many League goals did Ian wright score for the club?
questions.explanation:
89.

	Wright scored a total of 117 goals in all competitions, and made a total of 277 appearances between 1985-91.

questions.text: Which of these made the most appearances for the club?
questions.explanation:
Jim Cannon.

	Cannon played 571 games for the club between 1973-88.

questions.text: Palace appeared in the 1990 FA Cup final against Manchester United, and draw the first game 3-3. Ian Wright scored two of the goals, but who got the other?
questions.explanation:
Gary O'Reilly.

	Palace went on to lose the replay 1-0, with Lee Martin scoring the only goal of the game for Manchester United.

questions.text: Palace were the champions of Division One in season 1993-94.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Palace won promotion to the Premiership with 90 points, and 27 wins from 46 games, drawing 9 and losing 10 in the process.

questions.text: Where did Palace sign Dele Adebola from in 2002?
questions.explanation:
Birmingham City.

	Nigerian born forward Adebola started his career at Crewe in 1993, before moving on to Birmingham. He had a spell on-loan at Oldham in 2002 before moving to Palace.
